sen.e: Mimizuka is a tomb mound that was made to bury and pay respects to severed ears and noses of dead soldiers of Korean (Joseon) and Chinese (Ming) armies in Bunroku-Keicho no Eki (wars initiated by invasion of Korean Peninsula by Hideyoshi's army in 1592 through 1598).
